snippet: The proposal, to be included in the administration’s budget request, is part of its effort to fight climate change. The revenue would be spent on highway infrastructure and research.
abstract: Pres Obama will  propose new fee on oil companies, entailing $10 on every barrel of oil they produce; amount could total $32 billion in new federal revenue annually, which would be earmarked for transportation and infrastructure projects.
lead_paragraph: The proposal, to be included in the administration’s budget request, is part of its effort to fight climate change. The revenue would be spent on highway infrastructure and research.

headline.main: Obama to Propose a $10-a-Barrel Fee on Oil
headline.print_headline: Obama to Propose a Fee on Oil to Pay for Transportation Projects
